pageContext.claim: “We have the European Union -- they don't treat us right. They treat our farmers terribly. You can hardly sell into the -- they have barriers and they have tariffs that are massive.”
pageContext.analysis: The E.U. and the U.S. have the largest bilateral trade relationship in the world. On average, tariffs are relatively low — averaging around 2 percent. There are products where tariffs are steeper, but that is also two sided. The E.U. does have a 10 percent tariff on cars, but the U.S. imposes a 14 percent tariff on train cars. Plus, while there is an overall trade deficit, the U.S. continues to have a surplus in services traded with Europe.
